meanings.definition: To become steeper or more inclined.
meanings.sent1: The hill steepens as we climb higher.
meanings.sent2: The road steepens as it approaches the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The challenge steepens as we reach the final stretch.
meanings.sent4: Her determination steepens like a mountain slope.
meanings.sent5: The sense of danger steepens with each step up the steep hill.

meanings.definition: To make something more steep or inclined.
meanings.sent1: He uses rocks to steepen the path up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers steepen the slope for better drainage.
meanings.sent3: Adding more sand will steepen the sandcastle's walls.
meanings.sent4: Her words steepen the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chef decides to steepen the flavor of the soup with more spices.
